answerArr: In asynchronous processing, the server places incoming requests into a buffer, and signals are used to start processing them. In synchronous processing, requests are processed immediately as they come in and no signals are required.

In synchronous processing, the server handles one request at a time, blocking all others until it is fully processed, while in asynchronous processing, multiple requests can be processed at the same time without blocking.
